intro: Loudetia lualabaensis, commonly known as the Lualaba grass, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typical of many grasses. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a smooth surface, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Loudetia lualabaensis is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
